page.title: 14LANDSCAPE IN PANTON
page.content: {PANTON'S }district consists of gently undulating countryside interspersed with deciduous and coniferous woodlands. Some of the coniferous woods were planted by the Forestry Commission who maintain and replant the woods when necessary. Most of the cottages were erected by the Turnor family of the former {PANTON}Hall in the Cl8 and are of brick construction with slate roofs but, where modernis- ation has taken place, the slates have been sympathetically replaced with grey pantiles. Warren Farm buildings, built by John Carr in l777, still remain. These consist of large brick barns and stables with slate roofs and, although recent modern barns have been erected, the brick ranges show the character of former farming times.
